oracle.jbo.common.ampool
Interface SessionCookieFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultSessionCookieFactory, RemoteCookieFactory
public interface SessionCookieFactory

Interface for session cookie factories.

The session cookie factory is used by the application pool to instantiate session cookie instances.

Application developers may create their own SessionCookieFactory implementations to return custom SessionCookie implementations.

See Also:
ApplicationPool.setSessionCookieFactory(SessionCookieFactory)

Method Detail

createSessionCookie

SessionCookie createSessionCookie(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                  java.lang.String sessionId,
                                  ApplicationPool pool,
                                  java.util.Properties properties)
Creates a SessionCookie instance.

Parameters:
applicationId - an identifier which may be used to uniquely identify this cookie within the context of a session

sessionId - an option identifier which may be used to uniquely identify this cookie across sessions.

pool - the applicationPool instance which will be used to acquire ApplicationModule instances for this SessionCookie.

properties - an optional properties object which may be used to pass additional creation properties to the SessionCookieFactory.
